alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:53AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Alleghany, northwestern Rockbridge, southern Bath Counties in west central Virginia and southeastern Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia and the City of Covington through 845 AM EDT... At 753 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Natural Well, or near Covington, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Covington... Clifton Forge... Goshen... Warm Springs... Millboro... Hot Springs... and Iron Gate. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
